main event: On July 24, 1958, in West Nyark, New York, a visual observation of a probable meteor sighting was reported. The object was observed to move from East to West, had a slightly elliptical shape, and left a vapor trail before disappearing in the Western sky.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 3-10 seconds, and only one object was reported.
The conclusion indicates that the observation was likely a meteor.
A prior UFO report from July 2, 1955, described 2 or 3 silvery, elliptical objects moving erratically and hovering in the air before continuing on.
The motion of the objects in the 1955 report was described as both fast and slow, with the long axis at an angle of about 45 degrees.
The report includes a reference to ATIC (Air Technical Intelligence Center) advising on the 1955 UFO observation.
